page.title: 15HOUSING SOUTH OF HORNDON .
page.content: The housing in the area consisted mainly of detached and semi-detached bungalows.The bungalows were built during the inter war years.The majority of the bungalows were brick built with stucco (often painted) covering the upper half of the walls.Many bungalows were double fronted and often had wooden porches attached to the front door.Very few bungalows appeared to have been double glazed.The majority of the plots were rectangular with the shortest length facing the road.The narrow width of the frontages prevents the building of garages .We also noted a few large houses,they were mainly brick built and some had plaster covering the upper half of the walls.These houses often had square plots in excess of half an acre.
